The man who would take the name Foras grew up millennia ago among worshipers of [Pharasma](/Deities.aspx?ID=14), yet he came to believe that the Outer Gods were the keys to claiming personal power. He tricked his people's priests into to imparting eldritch truths they would not normally share, then shared them with a few fellow secretive scholars of the occult. Gathering those whom Foras could manipulate, he retreated to a new stronghold—a location now known as Candlemere. Here, Foras's cult gave up their sight and their souls, only to become trapped with him within their own compound when their leader's brother tracked them down and imprisoned them. Yet even this hasn't stymied Foras, and he continues to this day to work toward his goal of drawing [Yog-Sothoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=166) into the world. **[Recall Knowledge - Humanoid](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)** ([Society](/Skills.aspx?ID=14)): DC 49 **[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 47 **[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 44 [Foras](/NPCs.aspx?ID=2191) **Source** [Kingmaker Adventure Path](/Sources.aspx?ID=150) pg. 595 **Perception** +33; unseen sight **Languages** [Aklo](/Languages.aspx?ID=13), [Hallit](/Languages.aspx?ID=37) **Skills** [Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +33, [Arcana](/Skills.aspx?ID=2) +34, [Deception](/Skills.aspx?ID=5) +37, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +35, [Occultism](/Skills.aspx?ID=11) +37, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +33, [YogSothoth Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +37 **Str** +0 **Dex** +4 **Con** +2 **Int** +5 **Wis** +4 **Cha** +6 **Unseen Sight** This is a precise sense that mimics [darkvision](/MonsterAbilities.aspx?ID=12) yet functions even if the eye sockets themselves are covered. More importantly, the unseen sight allows a Thresholder to see the truth of the world, granting them the ability to see things as they actually are as if they were under the effects of [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344), provided they are located within a region under the influence of YogSothoth. Currently in the Stolen Lands, this is limited to the island of Candlemere and the dungeons within it; beyond this area, the Thresholder cultists are [blind](/Conditions.aspx?ID=1). **Items** [religious symbol](/Equipment.aspx?ID=41) of [Yog-Sothoth](/Deities.aspx?ID=166), _+2 [greater resilient](/Equipment.aspx?ID=279) [explorer's clothing](/Armor.aspx?ID=2)_, [_staff of power_](/Equipment.aspx?ID=361) --- **AC** 43 **Fort** +31 **Ref** +31 **Will** +35 resolve **HP** 355 **Resistances** [mental](/Traits.aspx?ID=106) 20 **Outside of Time** Foras exists outside of time; he doesn't age, doesn't need food or drink to survive, and can't be [quickened](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32) or [slowed](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) unless he chooses to be
**Resolve** When Foras rolls a success on a Will save, he gets a critical success instead.
**Time Siphon** ([aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [occult](/Traits.aspx?ID=120)) 60 feet. A living creature that enters the aura or ends its turn within it has some of its temporal essence drained away to Yog-Sothoth. It must succeed at a DC 38 Will save or become [slowed 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=35) for 1 round (slowed 2 on a critical failure). Worshipers of Yog-Sothoth are immune to Time Siphon. --- **Speed** 25 feet **Melee** _staff_ +31 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [two-hand d8](/Traits.aspx?ID=198)), **Damage** 3d4+10 bludgeoning **Occult Spontaneous Spells** DC 41, attack +36 - **Cantrips (10th)** [Chill Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=35), [Dancing Lights](/Spells.aspx?ID=58), [Daze](/Spells.aspx?ID=61), [Prestidigitation](/Spells.aspx?ID=229), [Read Aura](/Spells.aspx?ID=246) - **1st** [Color Spray](/Spells.aspx?ID=44), [Mending](/Spells.aspx?ID=189), [Ray of Enfeeblement](/Spells.aspx?ID=244), [Spider Sting](/Spells.aspx?ID=300) (4 slots) - **2nd** [Death Knell](/Spells.aspx?ID=63), [Hideous Laughter](/Spells.aspx?ID=150), [See Invisibility](/Spells.aspx?ID=271), [Touch of Idiocy](/Spells.aspx?ID=341) (4 slots) - **3rd** [Enthrall](/Spells.aspx?ID=104), [Hypercognition](/Spells.aspx?ID=156), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [Vampiric Touch](/Spells.aspx?ID=354) (4 slots) - **4th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48), [Fly](/Spells.aspx?ID=125), [Read Omens](/Spells.aspx?ID=247), [Telepathy](/Spells.aspx?ID=337) (4 slots) - **5th** [Black Tentacles](/Spells.aspx?ID=23), [Crushing Despair](/Spells.aspx?ID=57), [Synesthesia](/Spells.aspx?ID=328), [Tongues](/Spells.aspx?ID=340) (4 slots) - **6th** [Confusion](/Spells.aspx?ID=48), [Feeblemind](/Spells.aspx?ID=112), [Slow](/Spells.aspx?ID=289), [True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344) (4 slots) - **7th** [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180), [Spirit Blast](/Spells.aspx?ID=301), [Visions of Danger](/Spells.aspx?ID=358), [Warp Mind](/Spells.aspx?ID=369) (4 slots) - **8th** [Mask of Terror](/Spells.aspx?ID=185), [Maze](/Spells.aspx?ID=187), [Scintillating Pattern](/Spells.aspx?ID=267), [Uncontrollable Dance](/Spells.aspx?ID=347) (4 slots) - **9th** [Magic Missile](/Spells.aspx?ID=180), [Overwhelming Presence](/Spells.aspx?ID=212), [Telepathic Demand](/Spells.aspx?ID=336), [Unfathomable Song](/Spells.aspx?ID=349) (4 slots) - **10th** [Time Stop](/Spells.aspx?ID=339) (1 slot) **Sorcerer Bloodline Spells** DC 41, 3 Focus Points - **10th** [Aberrant Whispers](/Spells.aspx?ID=491), [Tentacular Limbs](/Spells.aspx?ID=517), [Unusual Anatomy](/Spells.aspx?ID=519) **Accelerated Existence** Foras is [quickened 1](/Conditions.aspx?ID=32), and he can use this additional action to Step, Stride, or Sustain a Spell. **Steady Spellcasting** If a reaction would disrupt Foras's spellcasting action, he attempts a DC 15 flat check; on a success, the action isn't disrupted.
